703719f-a.title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Clark Street
703719f-a.text:
170-178 Columbia Heights, west side, south of Clark Street. The Shear-
man homestead, a land mark for the past century, was purchased by Carl Gottes.
PVn, New York Investor, who plans to erect a modern apartment on site.
1934.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
703719f-a.folder: Columbia Heights & Clark Street, Brooklyn, NY

703717f-a.title: Brooklyn: Columbia Heights - Clark Street
703717f-a.text:
138-148 Columbia Heights, west side, between Clark and Pineapple
Streets. The numbers in this view are from right to left. Maresi the
Caterer,began business as such,(1888) at No. 80 Clinton Street, Brooklvn.
He lived in the second house from the left. This house was erected for
Isaac Henderson,Publisher of the Evening Post. In the next house once
lived John Freeland.collector of JInternal Revenue.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

703720f-a.text:
194-222 Columbia Heights, west sidc, between Clark and Pierrepont
